comment:
If you are in college, and you have worked a majority of your high school/college time, you will find the class to be very interesting. The lectures are insightful onto how managerial styles are. 

As for the work load, as long as you do decent on the quizzes, and you complete the group assignments, there is no reason why you shouldn't have an A.

This was one of the best teachers I have ever had. This teacher took so much care of each student and helped to get the grade that you wanted even if you run out of time. Please get to know this teacher put me on track to focus on a career.

Professor Gecowets, AKA "Dr. G" never assigns anything that seems "pointless" EVER. His discussion post topics are so, so fun. His passion and consideration for his students is UNDENIABLE! Class was not mandatory, but I CHOSE not to miss a single one! If you want to have fun learning in a college course, this is the one for you.
The class was great well laid out with plenty of time to complete assigned tasks, he worked to make the class enjoyable, picked up plenty of good information, test are all on the assigned subjects.

Professor G was awesome. Just go to class and turn your work in on time and the class is an easy A. He actually cares if you do good in the class and will work with you if you put effort in an effort. Quizzes can be a little difficult but other than that the class is a breeze.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are looking for an easy A, get him. three group project assignments that are very doable. He cares for his students and loves to talk! Very engaging classes and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities

Professor Gecowets was amazing. He was caring and willing to work with students to help them succeed. He gave lots of real-world lessons; if you want to not only learn but grow, take him! The class was also not hard, just reading the book and taking quizzes and practice questions along with a really easy group project. I would 100% recommend.

I enjoyed Professor Gecowets's class. You learn a lot of skills and processes that you can take into your own fields/jobs. While he can be a tough grader at times, he is super nice and understanding! The class is mostly focused on group work. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for an interesting and fun class to take.

I really enjoyed this class. Prof G. was very engaging. Since he has worked in the HR and management fields, he provides great insight to real word experiences and situations. The class is not hard. As long as you are participating and trying you will do great. Not only is he experienced seems like an overall good guy.
He took practical measures to show the essence of Innovation in Business. The Guest-speaker sessions also enlightened us on how to start from the ideation phase, to solve so-called wicked problems.

Mr G. was an amazing Professor.  He is a fair Professor, has great humor, and most important has experience that reinforces what he teaches.  If your wondering if this professor is a fit for you than I strongly urge you to take his class.  You wont be disappointed.

Professor Gecowets is a kind hearted man and cares about his students. As long as you talk to him and participate in his lectures, he will help you and guide you to passing the class! He is very good and explaining his topics and using relatable examples to help you understand them.
Great professor. Easy group project and weekly quizzes/assignments. Reopened 2 quizzes at the end of semester that you missed. Take him! Easy A
Hands down the best Professor ever! In and out of the classroom he is available to assist and aid with any issues. He is caring and respectful and the class was extremely engaging!

If you learn well by doing 100+ smart book questions per week and 2-3 group projects as well as tests and quizzes, Then this is your guy. If you are a normal person and smartbook is the worst thing to happen to education then pick anyone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework
